bool FindIndex (DBObject db)
 Finds the index for this record based on the columns that are not null. This will ignore the current Primary Key column, overwriting it's value.
bool FindIndex (DBObject db, string[] columns)
 Finds the index from only the columns specified. This will ignore the current Primary Key column, overwriting it's value.
void FillFromIndex (DBObject db)
 Fills the row from the database using the Primary Key. Any existing values in the row will be overwritten.
void FillFromIndex (DBObject db, bool onlyNullColumns)
 Fills the row from the database using the Primary Key. You can set if the existing columns should be overwritten or not with onlyNullColumns.

void DBObject2.DBRow.FillFromIndex ( DBObject  db )

Fills the row from the database using the Primary Key. Any existing values in the row will be overwritten.

Parameters:
dbThe DBObject to use.
void DBObject2.DBRow.FillFromIndex ( DBObject  db,
bool  onlyNullColumns 
)

Fills the row from the database using the Primary Key. You can set if the existing columns should be overwritten or not with onlyNullColumns.

Parameters:
dbThe DBObject for this row
onlyNullColumnsIf True, it will only update the columns that are currently null, keeping any existing data. If False it will replace any existing values.
bool DBObject2.DBRow.FindIndex ( DBObject  db,
string[]  columns,
int  attempts 
) [protected]

Finds the index from only the columns specified. This will ignore the current Primary Key column, overwriting it's value.

Parameters:
dbThe DBObject for this row
columnsThe columns that must match for it to be considered.
attemptsThe number of times to keep trying this method incase of error.
